title: G935 headset very directional sound with TFT
body: Hello, I'm using a G935 headset and when playing TFT I find the sound to be very directional, like for instance if my little legend is standing on his podium and I emote, I can't hear it at all on the right side of my headset, I've made sure that surround sound was turned off so I know that's not the problem.

replies.body:
Turning off surround sound usually won't turn off multi-channel audio, it will just drop it down from 5 or 7 channels (surround) to the basic 2 channel left and right.

If you are on Windows, you can switch most headsets to mono by following these steps:
1. Right-click the speaker on your taskbar and select "Sounds".
2. Switch to the "Playback" tab.
3. Right-click the listing for your headset and select "Configure speakers".
4. Switch the audio channel to mono.

If the mono option isn't there it usually means that device doesn't support one channel audio, but the vast majority of headsets will. You may also be able to change this in the Logitech Software, and the LGS may in fact override the Windows settings or visa versa, so you might have to play around a bit.

This absolutely fixed my issue, thank you. I went into the ease of access settings in Windows 10 and set Windows to force Mono Audio, thank you for helping me out and I hope you have an amazing day! :)
